content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is an example of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:
```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10))
    lines = string.split(text, " "))
    
    for i in 1:length(lines) - text_width + 1)
        println("\n" * (i - 1))))
end
```

Here is an example of using the `wrap_string` function:
```julia
text = "This is a very long sentence that will wrap around multiple lines."
text_width = 80

result = wrap_string(text, text_width))
println(result)
```

The output of this code would be:
```julia
This   is   a   very   long   sentence   that   will   wrap   around   multiple   lines.

This   is   a   very   long   sentence   that   will   wrap   around   multiple   lines.

This   is   a   very   long   sentence   that   will   wrap   around   multiple   lines.
